topic.title: HP Helion 1.0 Development Platform: Kato Command Reference

body.p: Kato is the Application Lifecycle Service command line administration utility.

ul.li: config Manipulate configuration values of Application Lifecycle Service components.

data Import or export Application Lifecycle Service system data to or from clusters/nodes.
data export
data import
data users

debug Commands for debugging for Application Lifecycle Service internals.
debug configwatch
debug redis
history Show the kato commands that have been run
info Show information about this node or cluster.
inspect Detect common problems with your Application Lifecycle Service installation.

log Logging utilities for Application Lifecycle Service
log drain
log stream
log tail

node Node management
node attach
node detach
node list
node migrate
node remove
node rename
node reset
node retire
node setup
node upgrade
node version
op Various operational commands
custom_ssl_cert
dhcp
defer
max_client_upload
regenerate
remap_hosts
run_deferred
set_timezone
static_ip
upstream_proxy
update_hostsfile
generate_service_tokens
help
user
pass
no-restart
patch Update an Application Lifecycle Service cluster with post-release fixes.

process Start, stop, or restart individual processes. Generally not required.
process list
process ready
process restart
process start
process stop
relocate Move containers, application droplets, or services to a new mount point
report Generate a report that can be sent to Application Lifecycle Service support.
restart Restart Application Lifecycle Service or individual roles.

role Management of node roles
role add
role info
role remove
shell Interactive shell for kato
start Start Application Lifecycle Service or individual roles.
status List configured roles and their current status across the cluster.
stop Stop Application Lifecycle Service or individual roles.
version Display the version of Application Lifecycle Service being run.

section.title: Config
section.p: Manipulate configuration values of Application Lifecycle Service components.
\<value> If value is not given for "set", then it read from STDIN.
\<component> Can be "cluster", "local" or the name of a process.
-j --json For "set", use JSON format when setting config key values. For "get", use JSON format for displaying output.
-y --yaml Use YAML format when retrieving or setting config key values. YAML is the default output format.
--force Force updating value to different type.

section.title: Data
section.p: Import or export Application Lifecycle Service system data to or from clusters/nodes.

section.title: Data Export
section.p: Exports Application Lifecycle Service system data to or from clusters/nodes. With no options specified, includes all data except 'resources' and 'aok-config'.
\<filename> The filename the export will be written to
--manual Only import/export roles specified on the command line
--force Force import/export of specified roles even if they are not enabled. Requires --manual. Implies --only-this-node
--base-dir \<base-dir> Base directory for extracting temporary files
--exclude-resources Do not include the upload cache (default)
--license Include the Application Lifecycle Service license
--exclude-license Do not include the Application Lifecycle Service license
--main-db Include the cloud controller's main database
--exclude-main-db Do not include the cloud controller's main database
--helion-rest-db Include Application Lifecycle Service Rest's database
--exclude-helion-rest-db Do not include Application Lifecycle Service Rest's database
--exclude-filesystem Do not include the filesystem service
--exclude-filesystem-data Do not include the filesystem service's user data
--exclude-filesystem-user-creation Do not include the filesystem service's user creation/quota
--exclude-harbor Do not include the harbor service
--exclude-harbor-data Do not include the harbor service's user data
--exclude-harbor-metadata Do not include the harbor service's metadata
--exclude-mysql Do not include the MySQL service
--exclude-mysql-data Do not include the MySQL service's data
--exclude-mysql-metadata Do not include the MySQL service's metadata
--exclude-postgresql Do not include the PostgreSQL service
--exclude-postgresql-data Do not include the PostgreSQL service's data
--exclude-postgresql-metadata Do not include the PostgreSQL service's metadata
--exclude-mongodb Do not include the MongoDB service
--exclude-mongodb-data Do not include the MongoDB service's data
--exclude-mongodb-metadata Do not include the MongoDB service's metadata
--exclude-memcached Do not include the memcached service
--exclude-memcached-data Do not include the memcached service's data
--exclude-memcached-metadata Do not include the memcached service's metadata
--exclude-redis Do not include the Redis service
--exclude-redis-data Do not include the Redis service's data
--exclude-redis-metadata Do not include the Redis service's metadata
--exclude-rabbit Do not include the RabbitMQ service
--exclude-rabbit-data Do not include the RabbitMQ service's data
--exclude-rabbit-metadata Do not include the RabbitMQ service's metadata
--exclude-rabbit3 Do not include the RabbitMQ service
--exclude-rabbit3-data Do not include the RabbitMQ service's data
--exclude-rabbit3-metadata Do not include the RabbitMQ service's metadata

section.title: Data Import
section.p: Imports Application Lifecycle Service system data to or from clusters/nodes. With no options specified, includes all data except 'resources' and 'aok-config'.
\<source> This can be a hostname or a filename to import from.
--manual Only import/export roles specified on the command line
--force Force import/export of specified roles even if they are not enabled. - Requires --manual - Implies --only-this-node
--base-dir \<base-dir> Base directory for extracting temporary files
--legacy Treat import as a legacy services import (internal use only)
--exclude-resources Do not include the upload cache (default)
--license Include the Application Lifecycle Service license
--exclude-license Do not include the Application Lifecycle Service license
--db-encryption-key Include the key used to encrypt the Application Lifecycle Service DB (recommended)
--main-db Include the cloud controller's main database
--exclude-main-db Do not include the cloud controller's main database
--helion-rest-db Include Application Lifecycle Service Rest's database
--exclude-helion-rest-db Do not include Application Lifecycle Service Rest's database
--exclude-filesystem Do not include the filesystem service
--exclude-filesystem-data Do not include the filesystem service's user data
--exclude-filesystem-user-creation Do not include the filesystem service's user creation/quota
--exclude-harbor Do not include the harbor service
--exclude-harbor-data Do not include the harbor service's user data
--exclude-harbor-metadata Do not include the harbor service's metadata
--exclude-mysql Do not include the MySQL service
--exclude-mysql-data Do not include the MySQL service's data
--exclude-mysql-metadata Do not include the MySQL service's metadata
--exclude-postgresql Do not include the PostgreSQL service
--exclude-postgresql-data Do not include the PostgreSQL service's data
--exclude-postgresql-metadata Do not include the PostgreSQL service's metadata
--exclude-mongodb Do not include the MongoDB service
--exclude-mongodb-data Do not include the MongoDB service's data
--exclude-mongodb-metadata Do not include the MongoDB service's metadata
--exclude-memcached Do not include the memcached service
--exclude-memcached-data Do not include the memcached service's data
--exclude-memcached-metadata Do not include the memcached service's metadata
--exclude-redis Do not include the Redis service
--exclude-redis-data Do not include the Redis service's data
--exclude-redis-metadata Do not include the Redis service's metadata
--exclude-rabbit Do not include the RabbitMQ service
--exclude-rabbit-data Do not include the RabbitMQ service's data
--exclude-rabbit-metadata Do not include the RabbitMQ service's metadata
--exclude-rabbit3 Do not include the RabbitMQ service
--exclude-rabbit3-data Do not include the RabbitMQ service's data
--exclude-rabbit3-metadata Do not include the RabbitMQ service's metadata

section.title: Data Users
section.p: Import or export a list of Application Lifecycle Service users (CSV format).
-p --exclude-password-hashes Do not include hashed passwords in export
-d --dry-run Do not import/export anything, just show what will be done

section.title: Debug
section.p: Commands for debugging for Application Lifecycle Service internals.
-d --dump-tree Dump the config tree seen since starting
-s --no-value Do not print the value of path
Connect to the Redis server used for cluster config via redis-cli

section.title: History
section.p: Show the kato commands that have been run.
-n --node \<node-IP> Get command history from a specific cluster node

section.title: Info
section.p: Show information about this node or cluster including assigned and available roles.
-n --node \<node-IP> Show info on a specific cluster node

section.title: Inspect
section.p: Detect common problems with your Application Lifecycle Service installation.
To use a specific group of tests, run:

section.title: Log
section.p: Logging utilities for Application Lifecycle Service.

section.title: Examples:

li.p: Add a drain to receive system logs

codeblock.codeph: kato log drain add system\_splunk udp://logs.splunk.com:1234/

li.p: Add a drain to forward all application and system logs as json

codeblock.codeph: kato log drain add -f json -p apptail,systail app\_sys\_splunk udp://logs.splunk.com:1235/

li.p: Add a drain with a custom or named format,

codeblock.codeph: kato log drain add -f ": " system\_splunk\_2 udp://logs.splunk.com:1236/ kato log drain add -f systail-syslog system\_splunk\_2 udp://logs.splunk.com:1236/

li.p: Passing custom parameters to a drain

codeblock.codeph: kato log drain add mydrain redis://localhost:6379 key=logdata

section.p: -p --prefix \<prefix> Message key prefix; possible values: systail, event, apptail (comma-separated, no spaces)
Show the status of all or specified log drains

section.title: Examples:

li.p: stream DEA and app log stream

codeblock.codeph: kato log stream systail.dea systail.stager apptail

li.p: stream system logs (equivalent to 'kato log tail')

section.p: --raw Show unformatted logs, including logyard INFO records (skipped by default)
-n --node \<node-IP> Only show logs from a specific cluster node
-l --local Only show logs from the current node
\<component> Can be a process name, role name or role group name
--raw Show unformatted logs, including logyard INFO records (skipped by default)
-n --node \<node-IP> Only show logs from a specific cluster node
-l --local Only show logs from the current node

section.title: Node
section.p: Attach this node to a core node
-e --enable \<roles> Enable the specified roles (comma-separated, no spaces)
-v --verbose Show process information when starting/stopping roles
-f --force Forces this node to attach to a core node, ignoring any version mismatches
Detach this node from a core node
-v --verbose Show process information when starting/stopping roles
List all nodes known to this cluster
-j --json Use JSON format for displaying output
-y --yaml Use YAML format for displaying output
Migrate the node configuration from old node to a new node
-r --no-restart Do not restart roles after migration
Remove the node from the cluster
-s --skip-remap-hosts Skip the remapping of existing app URLS to the new domain.
-v --verbose Show process information when restarting roles.
Reset the Application Lifecycle Service VM to its default configuration.

ul.li: soft: clears all data and resets the VM to its state immediately after first boot.
factory: returns the VM to its state prior to first boot.

section.p: Gracefully retires a DEA node from the cluster. New instances of the apps are started on other available DEAs before the retiring DEA is shut down.
-n --node \<node-id> Retire the specified DEA node, local node is used if not specified
Configure the core node of your Application Lifecycle Service cluster
-p --password \<password> First user's password. If your unix password has not been updated, then your unix password will be updated to this. Will be prompted for if not given.
-u --username \<username> First user's username. Will be the provided email if not given.
Configure this node as a HTTP/S load balancer
Configure this instance as a micro cloud
-d --delete Delete old configuration and re-initialize everything
-v --version \<version> The version of Application Lifecycle Service to upgrade to. The latest version is used if this isn't supplied.
--rollback Rolls Application Lifecycle Service back to the previous version.
--resume Resumes an upgrade process, used internally by Kato and should only be called manually when requested.
--cluster Performs an upgrade of all nodes in the cluster.
--status Shows the status of upgrades on a node.
-j --json Shows the status in json format.
-u --update-kato Updates kato node upgrade to the latest codebase.
--role-order \<role-order> Comma separated list of roles defining the order that roles should be upgraded in a cluster.
--ignore-inspect-failures Display pre/post upgrade 'kato inspect' tests as warnings instead of upgrade failures.

section.title: Other commands
section.p: custom_ssl_cert Allows admin configuration of custom SSL certificates to be used in conjunction with router2g and deployed applications.
dhcp Configures this node's networking to use DHCP
defer Defers a kato command to be run by 'op run_deferred'
max_client_upload Set the maximum upload size in MB
regenerate Regenerate the configuration for a process
remap_hosts Change the hostname to look for when remapping
run_deferred Runs any previously deferred kato commands
set_timezone Change the default system timezone for the host machine
static_ip Configures this node to use a static IP
upstream_proxy Configure Application Lifecycle Service to use an external or upstream proxy server and deployed apps.
update_hostsfile Updates the /etc/hosts file with the endpoint URI mapped to the CC's internal IP

section.title: Patch
section.p: Update an Application Lifecycle Service cluster with post-release fixes.
-n --only-this-node Only patch this node (otherwise entire cluster will be patched)
-r --no-restart Don't restart any roles during patching

section.title: Process
section.p: Start, stop, or restart individual processes. Generally not required.
Lists configured processes and their current running status.
-n --node \<node-IP> Get status for a specific cluster node (defaults to local node)
-c --cluster Includes process status over all cluster nodes
-j --json Use JSON format for displaying output
-y --yaml Use YAML format for displaying output
-b --block \<seconds> Block until ready, for max \<seconds> seconds. If \<seconds> is 0, then block forever.
-n --node \<node-IP> Check process on a specific cluster node
-n --node \<node-IP> Restart process on a specific cluster node
-c --cluster Restarts process on all nodes in the cluster
-n --node \<node-IP> Start process on a specific cluster node
-n --node \<node-IP> Stop process on a specific cluster node

section.title: Relocate
section.p: Move containers, application droplets, or services to a new mount point or filesystem location.

section.title: Report
section.p: Generate a report that can be sent to Application Lifecycle Service support.
-c --cluster Gather reports from entire cluster into one tarball
-n --node \<node-IP> Gather report from a specific cluster node

section.title: Restart
section.p: Restart the Application Lifecycle Service or individual roles.

section.title: Role
section.p: -b --all-but Enable all available roles except these
-o --only Enable only these roles, while disabling others
-n --node \<node-IP> Add a role on a specific cluster node
-b --all-but Disable all available roles except these
-n --node \<node-IP> Remove a role on a specific cluster node

section.title: Start
section.p: Start Application Lifecycle Service or individual roles.
-e --ephemeral Try not to regenerate/modify any config items

section.title: Status
section.p: List configured roles and their current status across the cluster.
List configured roles and their current status across the cluster.
-a --all Show all roles, including roles not configured on cluster
-j --json Use JSON format for displaying output.
-y --yaml Use YAML format for displaying output.

section.title: Stop
section.p: Stop Application Lifecycle Service or individual roles.

section.title: Version
section.p: Display the version of Application Lifecycle Service being run.
